name: Ias2016
tagline: Planetary Geology short course at the International Association of Sedimentologists 2016 Meeting
body:
# IAS 2016 Short Course: Introduction to Planetary Remote Sensing for Sedimentary Geology

### Short Description
The short course aims at providing basic knowledge on Planetary Sedimentary Geology with overall state of the art, planetary datasets, tools, techniques, and case studies with particular emphasis on Mars. 

At the end of the course participant will have gathered information on where to obtain and how to process data, mapping and analysis tips, practical work on exemplary location on Mars, where literature is abundant as well data coverage and ground truth.

The course will include both theoretical and practical components. Hands-on sessions will require access to either a shared workstation (to be confirmed) or own laptop and they will make use of existing processed data, but information for individual data preparation will be provided. 

The maximum number of participants (first come first served basis) is 20.

### Instructors
* [Angelo Pio Rossi](http://aprossi.eu)
* [Laetitia le Deit](https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Laetitia_Le_Deit)
* [Lauren Edgar](http://astrogeology.usgs.gov/people/lauren-edgar)
* [Nicolas Mangold](http://www.msl-chemcam.com/index.php?menu=inc&page_consult=textes&rubrique=88&art=322&titre_url=Nicolas%20Mangold#.VyCt1nq0fMs) 

### Agenda
Information on the agenda on [agenda.md](https://github.com/aprossi/ias2016/blob/master/agenda.md)

### Data
Data and (Open Source) tools will be provided by the instructors during the Short Course. More information on [data.md](https://github.com/aprossi/ias2016/blob/master/data.md)

### Resources
Additional resources are indicated on [resources.md](https://github.com/aprossi/ias2016/blob/master/resources.md)

### Contacts

Course contact points: [Angelo Pio Rossi](http://aprossi.eu) and [Laetitia le Deit](https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Laetitia_Le_Deit).
